   <div class="main">
    <section class="truth-header" id="truth-header">
     <div class="play" id="play">
      <div class="play-button" id="play-button">
       <svg class="icon-play-button" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">
        <use xlink:href="#icon-play-button" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
        </use>

       <svg class="icon-play-button-hover" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">

        </use>
       </svg>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="truth-video-outer-container" id="truth-video-outer-container">
      <div id="close-video">
       <svg class="icon-x-mint" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">
        <use xlink:href="#icon-x-mint" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
        </use>
       </svg>
      </div>
      <div class="truth-video-inner-container" id="truth-video-container">
      </div>
     </div>
    </section>
    <section class="headline">
     <div class="title-container">
      <h1>
       A Mattress Shouldn't
       <br/>
       Cost A Fortune.
      </h1>
     </div>
     <div class="subsection">
      <p>
       Over-priced, over-complicated mattresses have been the standard.
       <br/>
       Until now.
      </p>
     </div>
    </section>
    <section class="unfair-markups">
     <div class="subsection">
      <h1>
       Unfair Markups
      </h1>
      <p>
       Typically, mattresses are marked up 6-12 times from manufacture to point of sale. That means youre mostly paying for bad TV commercials, retail markups, sales commissions, and wholesalers profits.
      </p>
      <div class="chart">
       <svg class="icon-chart" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">
        <use xlink:href="#icon-chart" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
        </use>
       </svg>
       <ul>
        <li>
         Tuft &amp; Needle
        </li>
        <li>
         Online Store
        </li>
        <li>
         Physical Store
        </li>
       </ul>
      </div>
     </div>
    </section>
    <section class="sell-direct">
     <div class="container">
      <h1>
       We Sell Directly To You
      </h1>
      <div class="subsection">
       <svg class="icon-process" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">
        <use xlink:href="#icon-process" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
        </use>
       </svg>
       <svg class="icon-condensed-process" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">
        <use xlink:href="#icon-condensed-process" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
        </use>
       </svg>
       <h4 class="subtitle">
        Cutting Costs, Not Corners
       </h4>
       <p>
        We run our supply chain vertically and manufacture our products honestly. We cut out the middlemen so we can make a great product at a fair price.
       </p>
      </div>
     </div>
    </section>
    <section class="average-mattress-cost">
     <div class="container">
      <h1>
       What Does It Cost To Make The Average Mattress?
      </h1>
      <div class="mattress-image">
       <svg class="icon-mattress" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">
        <use xlink:href="#icon-mattress" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
        </use>
       </svg>
      </div>
      <ul class="cost-table">
       <li>
        <dl>
         <dt>
          Core
         </dt>
         <dd>
          $150
         </dd>
        </dl>
        <dl>
         <dt>
          Cover
         </dt>
         <dd>
          $80
         </dd>
        </dl>
        <dl>
         <dt>
          Sewing
         </dt>
         <dd>
          $40
         </dd>
        </dl>
        <dl>
         <dt>
          Cutting
         </dt>
         <dd>
          $15
         </dd>
        </dl>
        <dl>
         <dt>
          Finishing
         </dt>
         <dd>
          $15
         </dd>
        </dl>
       </li>
       <li>
        <dl>
         <dt>
          Actual Cost
         </dt>
         <dd>
          $300
         </dd>
        </dl>
       </li>
       <li>
        <dl>
         <dt>
          + Wholesale Markup
         </dt>
         <dd>
          $300
         </dd>
        </dl>
        <dl>
         <dt>
          + Marketing
         </dt>
         <dd>
          $300
         </dd>
        </dl>
        <dl>
         <dt>
          + Retail Markup
         </dt>
         <dd>
          $1800
         </dd>
        </dl>
        <dl>
         <dt>
          + Commissions
         </dt>
         <dd>
          $300
         </dd>
        </dl>
       </li>
       <li>
        <dl>
         <dt>
          Typical Retail Price
         </dt>
         <dd>
          $3,000
         </dd>
        </dl>
       </li>
      </ul>
     </div>
    </section>
    <section class="layers-scam">
     <div class="container">
      <h1>
       Zillion-Layer Mattresses Are A Scam
      </h1>
      <div class="subsection">
       <div class="graphic">
        <img alt="Two layer foam 1" src="https://d1mmgk36i9f3qd.cloudfront.net/images/two_layer_foam-1.png"/>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="subsection">
       <div class="graphic">
        <img alt="Multi layer foam 1" src="https://d1mmgk36i9f3qd.cloudfront.net/images/multi_layer_foam-1.png"/>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="container">
      <p>
       Every layer of foam or material needs a layer of glue and every layer of glue reduces air-flow. Reduced airflow means hot sleeping and paying for fancy material 10 layers deep that has no impact on your sleep. We've worked hard to reduce our layers to an ideal two.
      </p>
     </div>
    </section>
    <section class="no-gimmicks">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="subsection">
       <svg class="icon-nogimmick" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">
        <use xlink:href="#icon-nogimmick" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
        </use>
       </svg>
       <p>
        We dont believe in bells and whistles. Well never try to sell them to you.
       </p>
      </div>
      <div class="subsection description">
       <h1>
        No Gimmicks.
        <br/>
        Pure and Simple.
       </h1>
       <p>
        No snake oil, jargon, or convoluted product names. We sell the Tuft &amp; Needle Mattress 10" thick. Its made of Tuft and Needle foam, and high quality Tactel fabric. Simple.
       </p>
      </div>
     </div>
    </section>
    <section class="cta-panel">
     <div class="subsection">
      <h1>
       Sleep on an Honestly Crafted Mattress at a Fair Price
      </h1>
      <div class="cta">
       <a href="https://www.tuftandneedle.com/mattress">
        View Our Mattresses
       </a>
      </div>
     </div>
    </section>

        <span class="signature-link">
         |
        </span>
        <span class="signature-link">
         <a href="/legal/terms">
          Terms
         </a>
        </span>
        <span class="signature-link">
         |
        </span>
        <span class="signature-link">
         <a href="/legal/warranty">
          Warranty
         </a>
        </span>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="update-section">

        Tuft &amp; Needle Updates
       </div>

       </div>

     <article class="active" rel="mobile-support-faq">
      <input class="faq-search" id="faq-search-box" name="search" placeholder="Search by keyword" type="text"/>
      <section data-faq-category-id="1" data-id="46" id="what-kind-of-mattress-is-a-tuft-needle" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What kind of mattress is a Tuft &amp; Needle?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         The Tuft &amp; Needle Mattress is a high-quality, high-performance foam mattress made in the USA. Our foam, called Tuft &amp; Needle Adaptive Foam, is completely unique to our brand because we actually invented it. It combines pressure relief and support, which no other kind of foam offers.
        </p>
        <p>
         Designed to be a single firmness, we are continuously tweaking the specifications to be universally comfortable for everyone. Our foam supports the natural posture of your spine, relieving back, shoulder, and neck problems and naturally breathes so you don't sleep hot.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="1" data-id="47" id="how-does-tuft-needle-compare-to-a-memory-foam-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        How does Tuft &amp; Needle compare to a memory foam mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Although memory foam feels comfortable at first, its drawbacks are sleeping hot and lacking necessary support. Compared to memory foam, our Adaptive Foam's design offers consistent, healthy support and does not become hot during the night.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="1" data-id="48" id="how-does-tuft-needle-compare-to-a-latex-foam-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        How does Tuft &amp; Needle compare to a latex foam mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Latex foam is known for being breathable and supportive though not the best material for pressure relief. Our foam provides enhancements over latex with support, breathability, and pressure relief but at a much lower cost. It's important to note that all latex foams used in mattresses are not 100% natural when others claim them to beat most they are about 95% natural due to the curing package required to set the material. Latex normally is synthetic and is in many cases 0% to 30% natural due to chemicals and fillers.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="1" data-id="3" id="if-tuft-needle-is-such-a-great-mattress-why-does-it-cost-so-little" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        If Tuft &amp; Needle is such a great mattress, why does it cost so little?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Surprisingly, it doesn't cost a ton of money to craft a comfortable mattress with quality ingredients. We make quality mattresses and offer them for an honest price. Its such a straight-forward system, youd think more people would follow it.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="4" id="how-long-does-it-take-to-get-my-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        How long does it take to get my mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         It varies depending on our volume and your location. In most cases, you can expect delivery in about 1 week. Shoot us an email or give us a call for a better estimate of delivery to your specific location.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="5" id="what-is-the-transit-time-to-my-location" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What is the transit time to my location?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         We ship FedEx Ground from our facility in Southern California. Here are some estimated transit times based on FedEx's service maps:
        </p>
        <p>
         1-2 business days to California and the southwestern states
         <br/>
         3-4 business days to the Pacific Northwest, the central states and the Midwest
         <br/>
         4-6 business days to New England and other East Coast locations
         <br/>
         6-7 business days to Hawaii and Alaska locations.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="7" id="can-i-request-custom-instructions-for-delivery" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can I request custom instructions for delivery?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         While we're unable to schedule specific dates or times for delivery, we'd love to help with custom delivery instructions as best as we can. Just let us know after you place your order, and we will work with FedEx to try to arrange this once your mattress has shipped.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="9" id="can-you-ship-to-canada" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can you ship to Canada?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         We are not able to ship internationally at this time. When we send our Mattresses to customers, it's not just the product we're providing but the full experience - most importantly the 100 night sleep trial to make sure it's a good fit for you.
        </p>
        <p>
         If something happened to the Mattress, like a warranty issue, we'd want to take care of it. However, being out of our service region means we wouldn't be able to. We wouldn't want to put you in that position.
        </p>
        <p>
         Drop us a note via email or follow our social media profiles, and we'd be happy to let you know when we do.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="10" id="can-you-ship-internationally" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can you ship internationally?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         We are not currently shipping internationally. When we send our Mattresses to customers, it's not just the product we're providing but the full experience - most importantly the 100 night sleep trial to make sure it's a good fit for you.
        </p>
        <p>
         If something happened to the Mattress, like a warranty issue or you want to return, we'd want to take care of it. However, being out of our service region means we wouldn't be able to. We wouldn't want to put you in that position.
        </p>
        <p>
         Drop us a note via email or follow our social media profiles, and we'd be happy to let you know when we do.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="11" id="where-is-my-package-fedex-tracking-page-says-it-is-delivered-but-i-have-not-received-it" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Where is my package? FedEx Tracking page says it is delivered but I have not received it.
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Send us an email right away and we will work with FedEx to track down your package. In the case that the carrier misplaced or delivered your package to the wrong address, it can take up to 2 business days for them to complete their investigation with the driver. We will continue to work with FedEx to get you your mattress as soon as possible.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="12" id="why-is-my-order-status-not-being-updated" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Why is my order status not being updated?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         We do not update the order status until your mattress has shipped. Once your mattress has shipped you will receive an email with the shipping details. If more than a week has passed, please send us an email at support@tuftandneedle.com or let us know by phone at (877) 842-2586 so we can further assist.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="1" data-id="13" id="what-is-the-sleep-trial" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What is the Sleep Trial?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         We believe that you have to spend more than a few minutes on a mattress to know if it's right for you. That's why we offer the 100 night sleep trial. If you don't like it, we'll take it back with no questions asked, but feedback is always appreciated.
        </p>
        <p>
         Please note that the 100 night sleep trial applies to orders purchased directly through Tuft &amp; Needle's website. Any orders placed through Amazon will have a 30 night sleep trial.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="3" data-id="14" id="how-do-i-return-my-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        How do I return my mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         To return your mattress, we work together to donate it to a local charity or non-profit. It's that easy. Once your mattress is donated, send us a scanned or photographed copy of your donation receipt via email and we'll process your refund in full.
        </p>
        <p>
         We're experts at finding donation locations. If you're unsure of where to donate or need help, just let us know by phone or email support@tuftandneedle.com; we'd be happy to help find places! If we can't find a donation location, then we'll coordinate with a 3rd party pickup service free of charge.
        </p>
        <p>
         NOTE: If you recently received your mattress, we recommend allowing 1-2 weeks of use before initiating your return. It can take a little bit of time for your mattress to break in, and for you to become acclimated to it.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="3" data-id="15" id="do-i-have-to-ship-it-back-in-its-original-box-if-i-decide-to-return" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Do I have to ship it back in its original box if I decide to return?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         With the exception of New York returns, you do not need to keep the packaging. If you live in New York, we recommend keeping the plastic to make donations or recycling easier.
        </p>
        <p>
         Instead of shipping it back to us, we work together to donate the mattress to a nearby charity. Send us a scanned or photographed copy of your receipt and we'll process your full refund. If no charity is available nearby for donation, we'll arrange a 3rd party pickup for the mattress.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="10" data-id="16" id="is-the-return-process-different-if-i-ordered-through-amazon" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Is the return process different if I ordered through Amazon?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         If your mattress was "Sold by Amazon," then all returns and customer support questions should go through Amazon's support. We're always here to help with general questions, but they'll handle all returns, exchanges, and warranty issues.
        </p>
        <p>
         Please note that the 100 night sleep trial is only valid for orders purchased directly from the Tuft &amp; Needle website. The sleep trial for orders purchased through Amazon is 30 nights.
        </p>
        <p>
         Follow these few steps to begin your Amazon return:
        </p>
        <p>
         1. Go to the Amazon return page at https://www.amazon.com/returns/order
         <br/>
         2. Find your item in the list
         <br/>
         3. Click "Return or Replace Item"
         <br/>
         4. Amazon will help schedule a removal or arrange return shipping
        </p>
        <p>
         If your mattress was "Sold by Tuft &amp; Needle," then we will handle all aspects of your order and you can reach out to us by email, chat, or phone for help with returning, exchanging, or claiming the warranty.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="3" data-id="17" id="can-i-exchange-my-mattress-for-a-different-size-during-the-100-night-trial" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can I exchange my mattress for a different size during the 100-Night-Trial?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Yes, exchanges are available during the 100 night trial. Send us an email and let us know you'd like to make an exchange. With your approval, we'll process or return the remaining balance on your purchasing card. We cover the shipping cost of one exchange per household per year. Please note that exchanging your mattress will void the 100 night trial.
        </p>
        <p>
         Once you receive your new mattress, donate the original to a nearby non-profit or charity and send us a scanned or photographed copy of your donation receipt via email. If you're unsure of where or how to donate, let us know by phone or email support@tuftandneedle.com; we'll help you find some places.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="3" data-id="18" id="once-i-send-in-my-donation-receipt-how-long-does-it-take-to-get-my-refund" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Once I send in my donation receipt, how long does it take to get my refund?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Once we receive your proof of donation, our system processes the refund within 24 to 72 hours. If you do not see it back in your account within 3-5 business days, contact your bank or financial institution for further information.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="4" data-id="20" id="can-i-get-a-replacement-cover" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can I get a replacement cover?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Tuft &amp; Needle warrants any damages in the cover due to defects in materials and workmanship when used normally for a period of 10 years from the date of original purchase. Shoot us an email or give us a call if you have any concerns.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="4" data-id="21" id="what-if-the-foam-forms-irregular-indentations-and-is-getting-body-impressions" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What if the foam forms irregular indentations and is getting body impressions?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         This is unlikely to happen for at least 7-10 years. We consider increased softness such as body impressions or permanent indentations to  fall under our 10 year warranty. If you observe a visible indentation greater than 3/4 of an inch (about the length of your thumb, from tip to knuckle) please let our team know so that we can help you replace the mattress.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="4" data-id="22" id="why-do-you-only-offer-a-10-year-warranty-when-other-companies-offer-20-years" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Why do you only offer a 10 year warranty when other companies offer 20 years?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Warranties that are more than 10 years are generally prorated, which means for every year you own it, you would receive less and less credit. The reality is, other companies make it extremely difficult to prove damage and redeem the warranty.
        </p>
        <p>
         We help honor our customers loyalty by acting in good faith, and that means transparency, honesty, and accuracy in our pricing, and in our warranties. Send us some photographs, we'll help diagnose the issue, and we'd be happy to send a replacement per our warranty.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="5" data-id="24" id="how-does-the-mattress-feel-to-sleep-on" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        How does the mattress feel to sleep on?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Our product team designed our mattress to fit the most people with the most comfort, providing proper support throughout the body and relieving critical pressure points.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="5" data-id="25" id="how-firm-are-the-tuft-needle-mattresses" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        How firm are the Tuft &amp; Needle Mattresses?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Our mattress is designed to be plush on top while remaining supportive. Put differently, our mattresses are about a 6 or 7 on a scale of 1-10, with 1 being a feather pillow and 10 a hardwood floor.
        </p>
        <p>
         We've designed our foam to work with those who like soft mattresses as well as those who like firm, so we encourage everyone to give us a try regardless of your usual preference. If you're not 100% satisfied, you can return it for a full refund.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="5" data-id="26" id="what-does-the-mattress-look-like" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What does the mattress look like?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Our mattress is designed with square edges and corners. Our Tuft &amp; Needle logo is lightly woven into the fabric of the smooth white cover.
        </p>
        <p>
         We have some awesome product photography on our website. Check out the Prices page to see photos from all sides of the mattress.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="6" data-id="28" id="can-i-sleep-directly-on-my-tuft-needle-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can I sleep directly on my Tuft &amp; Needle mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         You can, but you should always use sheets (and ideally a protector too). You'll get the most out of your Tuft &amp; Needle mattress by washing or changing your sheets weekly.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="6" data-id="29" id="how-do-i-maintain-my-mattress-if-i-use-it-on-the-floor" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        How do I maintain my mattress if I use it on the floor?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         With all mattresses, there is a chance of mildew when it lacks airflow, especially over an organic (e.g. cotton rug, plywood) or moist surface. If you live in a humid climate, we recommend that you use a bed frame that lifts the mattress off the ground.
        </p>
        <p>
         For best care on the floor, we suggest that you regularly (once or twice a week) prop-up your mattress to refresh the air-flow; this will help keep your Tuft &amp; Needle mattress dry and clean.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="6" data-id="30" id="do-i-need-to-air-the-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Do I need to air the mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         In most cases, you won't need to air the mattress. We use spacer cloth on the mattress bottom to optimize air flow.  For floor use in more humid climates, we suggest that you regularly prop-up your mattress to refresh the air-flow; this will help keep your Tuft &amp; Needle mattress dry and clean.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="6" data-id="31" id="do-i-need-to-flip-my-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Do I need to flip my mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Our foam core has been designed to have a specific top and bottom. Always keep the zippered side down.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="6" data-id="32" id="can-i-clean-the-cover" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can I clean the cover?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Don't machine wash or dry the mattress cover; it may shrink. Instead, unzip and remove the cover and spot clean with a mild detergent - gently dabbing the cover rather than rubbing it. Make sure the cleaned area is 100% dry before replacing the cover or placing sheets and blankets back on the mattress.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="7" data-id="33" id="what-is-the-mattress-foam-density" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What is the mattress' foam density?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         The foam we designed currently has a density of 2.8 lbs for our top layer and about 1.8 lbs for our base layer.
        </p>
        <p>
         When shopping for a foam mattress, be sure to look for higher density foam. We recommend something above 1.8 lbs. Additionally, when looking for memory foam you'll want something even denser like 4+ lbs.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="7" data-id="34" id="what-makes-up-the-foam-core" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What makes up the foam core?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         What's inside our Tuft &amp; Needle Mattress is two layers of high-quality, high-performance foam, blended to our design and specifications. The bottom layer is a support layer of high-density polyfoam and the top layer is a comfort layer of Tuft &amp; Needle Adaptive Foam, which is completely unique to Tuft &amp; Needle. The foam has been tested to be safe by CertiPur standards and is long-lasting because of its density.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="7" data-id="35" id="what-is-the-cover-made-of" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What is the cover made of?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         It is a high quality rayon and polyester performance fabric.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="7" data-id="36" id="will-the-mattress-smell-or-off-gas" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Will the mattress smell or off-gas?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Some people notice a new mattress smell for a few days, but it goes away quickly. Initially, we suggest letting the mattress air out by removing any sheets or mattress protector that cover it. You can leave our fabric cover on. The smell comes from the freshly new foam being packaged during transit and not from any harmful chemicals.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="7" data-id="37" id="do-you-use-a-flame-retardant" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Do you use a flame retardant?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Our fire barrier is essentially a fabric blend. It's mostly rayon, blended with small amounts of polyester and silica (very fine-grained sand). When it's blended like that, it's inherently flame retardant. This fabric blend fits on the mattress like a sock, underneath the cover, and there are no chemical flame retardants in our foam. Our fire barrier is TB 117 compliant.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="7" data-id="38" id="can-i-have-a-sample-of-the-foam-or-cover-fabric" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can I have a sample of the foam or cover fabric?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Unfortunately, we are not able to provide samples of our mattress. Our foams have been tested by CertiPUR-US for off-gassing, formaldehyde, and a host of other toxins. Feel free to read more about that here: http://certipur.us/pages/
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="8" data-id="39" id="what-type-of-bed-frame-should-i-use-with-the-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What type of bed frame should I use with the mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Tuft &amp; Needle mattresses are designed to be compatible with most options such as a slatted frame, platform frame, box spring, hardwood floor or synthetic carpeted floor.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="8" data-id="40" id="do-you-carry-the-frame-or-furniture-pictured-on-your-site" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Do you carry the frame or furniture pictured on your site?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Any furniture showed on our website is for visual purposes only. If you like to know the brands or products we use, we'd be happy to let you know. You can reach us by phone, email, live chat, or through Twitter @tuftandneedle or on Facebook at http://facebook.com/tuftandneedle
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="8" data-id="41" id="what-do-you-mean-by-platform-slatted-slats-foundation-etc" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What do you mean by "platform," "slatted," "slats," "foundation," etc.?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Platform Bed Frame - Platform bed frames come in a variety of styles, and they either feature horizontal slats (think planks, usually wooden) or a solid platform for the mattress to rest on.
        </p>
        <p>
         Slatted Bed Frame - A slatted bed frame is another way of saying platform frame and gets its name from the characteristic horizontal slats that support the mattress.
        </p>
        <p>
         Slats - Slats are the planks that are usually placed horizontally on a slatted or platform frame. Their purpose is to support the mattress and their function is analogous to that of a box spring.
        </p>
        <p>
         Metal Bed Frame - Sometimes called a Hollywood bed frame, the metal frame is a traditional bed frame that supports a box spring + mattress.
        </p>
        <p>
         Box Spring - Traditionally featuring a wooden frame and springs, most modern box springs are, in fact, slatted or solid foundations. Their purpose is to provide even support under the mattress, and they work with either a metal bed frame or a platform bed.
        </p>
        <p>
         Solid Foundation - A solid foundation provides the support of a platform frame or slats, though it looks very much like a box spring and is used the same way: metal frame + solid foundation + mattress. Most modern box springs are solid or slatted foundations.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="8" data-id="43" id="what-kind-of-sheets-will-fit-my-tuft-needle-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What kind of sheets will fit my Tuft &amp; Needle mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Standard bed sheets will fit the Tuft &amp; Needle Mattress. We have found that when the fitted sheet has very strong elastic sewn all the way around, they fit nicely.
        </p>
        <p>
         Here are a couple we like:
        </p>
        <p>
         <a href="http://www.qvc.com/for-the-home/northern-nights/_/N-lgluZ1z141ph/c.html">
          Northern Nights for the Home
         </a>
         <br/>
         <a href="http://www.restorationhardware.com/catalog/category/collections.jsp?categoryId=cat3850009">
          Restoration Hardware
         </a>
        </p>
        <p>
         Other brands and stores we've had good experiences with include Eddie Bauer, TJMaxx, Target and even Ikea.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="9" data-id="44" id="are-there-any-discounts-promotions-or-coupon-codes" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Are there any discounts, promotions or coupon codes?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         We started Tuft &amp; Needle because of our own experiences with mattress gimmicks. This industry is already full of discount programs that deceptively inflate prices and trick people into thinking they are getting a deal. We believe that everyone should get the same pricethe fair price.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="4" data-id="45" id="how-do-i-make-use-of-the-warranty-if-i-think-my-tuft-needle-mattress-might-be-defective" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        How do I make use of the warranty if I think my Tuft &amp; Needle Mattress might be defective?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Your Tuft &amp; Needle Mattress is covered by warranty for 10 years against defects, and you can find the warranty here: https://www.tuftandneedle.com/about/warranty.
        </p>
        <p>
         If you discover a defect in your Tuft &amp; Needle, just email us support@tuftandneedle.com or give us a call at (877)842-2586 to let us know what's going on, and we'll go from there. A couple pictures may help illustrate your concern, so please include those when possible.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="5" data-id="49" id="what-size-should-i-purchase" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What size should I purchase?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Twin - Best for average height adults and children. This size typically fits trundle and bunk beds.
         <br/>
         Twin XL - Recommended for taller youth and adults. This size is commonly seen in college dorms. Two Twin-XL side by side will equal a King size.
         <br/>
         Full - A spacious, comfortable sleeping space for a single adult, but a tight sleeping space for two.
         <br/>
         Queen - The most popular size for two sleepers.
         <br/>
         King - The most space available width-wise. Great for two sleepers that like to spread out, or for sleeping with kids or pets.
         <br/>
         California King - The most space available length-wise. Great for two sleepers, or for sleeping with kids or pets.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="8" data-id="50" id="should-i-use-a-mattress-protector" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Should I use a mattress protector?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         The soft mattress cover is not water resistant, so using a mattress protector can help prolong the life of your mattress, protecting it from spills, as well as dirt or allergens. We suggest using a mattress protector with your Tuft &amp; Needle Mattress - especially if children or pets are using the mattress.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="8" data-id="51" id="what-should-i-look-for-in-a-mattress-protector" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What should I look for in a mattress protector?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         You'll want to look for a mattress protector that is breathable as well as moisture-resistant.
        </p>
        <p>
         Here are a couple we like for the Ten:
         <br/>
         <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Hospitology-Defense-%E2%80%8BWaterproof-Mattress-Encasement/dp/B005OLK55A/ref=sr_1_sc_2?ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1381352785&amp;sr=8-2-spell&amp;keywords=Hospitolgy">
          Hospitology
         </a>
         <br/>
         <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Luna-Hypoallergenic-Waterproof-Mattress-Protector/dp/B002AQNXR4/ref=sr_1_2?s=bedbath&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1412895551&amp;sr=1-2&amp;keywords=mattress+cover">
          Luna-AllSizes
         </a>
         <br/>
         <a href="http://www.amazon.com/SafeRest-Hypoallergenic-Waterproof-Mattress-Protector/dp/B003PWNH4Q/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1412895464&amp;sr=8-1&amp;keywords=saferest">
          SafeRest-AllSizes
         </a>
        </p>
        <p>
         If you need some other recommendations, don't hesitate to shoot us an email at support@tuftandneedle.com.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="8" data-id="52" id="what-types-of-mattress-protectors-are-there" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What types of mattress protectors are there?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         There are three basic types of mattress protective covers: encasement, fitted-sheet and pad. Encasement is just like it sounds; the encasement protector completely covers the mattress. The second type of protector fits the mattress like a fitted sheet. Both styles of protector are popular with people who suffer from allergies. Mattress pads are the most minimal and typically have elastic straps at the corners to secure it to the mattress.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="53" id="can-you-ship-to-alaska-or-hawaii" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can you ship to Alaska or Hawaii?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         We do ship to Alaska and Hawaii!
        </p>
        <p>
         Due to the increased costs of shipping, a charge is added to orders being sent to an Alaska or Hawaii address. The shipping costs range from $100-$190 per mattress, based on model, size, and destination.
        </p>
        <p>
         This charge will be reflected in your shopping cart as you check out. You will know the total cost before you buy.
        </p>
        <p>
         Please note that in the event of a return, the extra shipping cost will not be refunded.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="55" id="what-is-the-shipping-weight-of-the-tuft-needle-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What is the shipping weight of the Tuft &amp; Needle Mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         You can view all of the shipping info on our Buy Now page.
        </p>
        <p>
         Check it out
         <a href="/mattress/shop#size-and-weight">
          here
         </a>
         .
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="57" id="how-big-is-the-shipping-box-of-the-tuft-needle-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        How big is the shipping box of the Tuft &amp; Needle Mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         The size of the shipping box varies depending on the size of the mattress. Our mattress will ship in these size boxes:
        </p>
        <p>
         10 Twin: 44" x	16" x 16"
         <br/>
         10 XL: 44" x 16" x 16"
         <br/>
         10 Full: 44" x 16" x 16"
         <br/>
         10 Queen: 44" x 19" x 19"
         <br/>
         10 King: 44" x 19" x	19"
         <br/>
         10 Cal King: 44" x 19" x 19"
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="5" data-id="60" id="what-are-the-dimensions-of-the-ten" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What are the dimensions of the Ten?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         The Tuft &amp; Needle Ten Mattress is 10-inches thick and matches standard mattress dimensions.
         <br/>
         Twin: 39" x 75" x 10"
         <br/>
         TwinXL: 39" x 80" x 10"
         <br/>
         Full: 54" x 75" x 10"
         <br/>
         Queen: 60" x 80" x 10"
         <br/>
         King: 76" x 80" x 10"
         <br/>
         Cal-King: 72" x 84" x 10"
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="8" data-id="62" id="does-the-tuft-needle-mattress-need-a-box-spring" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Does the Tuft &amp; Needle mattress need a box spring?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         The short answer is no. We like platform or slatted frames because they have a great aesthetic. It isn't necessary to purchase a box spring if you don't already have one, but you can use one if you'd like to.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="7" data-id="64" id="can-the-tuft-needle-mattress-fold" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can the Tuft &amp; Needle mattress fold?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         The Tuft &amp; Needle Ten Mattress cannot be folded in half. The foam is too thick to fold properly and it can potentially damage the foam.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="7" data-id="65" id="what-is-the-weight-capacity-of-the-tuft-needle-ten-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What is the weight capacity of the Tuft &amp; Needle Ten Mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         The Tuft &amp; Needle Ten will support up to 500 lbs per person, for a total of 1000 lbs on a two sleeper mattress.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="7" data-id="68" id="how-do-i-unbox-the-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        How do I unbox the mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Position your mattress on top of your bed frame and find the ends of the plastic wrap stuck to the side of the roll. Pull on the end of the plastic until the mattress is completely unrolled.
        </p>
        <p>
         Roll the mattress out so that it's flat, then pull off the remaining plastic. Let it expand 2-3 hours and your mattress will be ready for sleep!
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="1" data-id="69" id="where-can-i-read-reviews-of-the-tuft-needle-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Where can I read reviews of the Tuft &amp; Needle Mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         All of our reviews are genuine and by our real customers. Our mattress is the #1 rated mattress on Amazon and you can read our reviews on their website
         <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Tuft-Needle-10-Inch-Mattress-Queen/product-reviews/B00QBZ265U/ref=cm_cr_pr_viewopt_srt?ie=UTF8&amp;showViewpoints=1&amp;sortBy=recent&amp;reviewerType=all_reviews&amp;formatType=all_formats&amp;filterByStar=all_stars&amp;pageNumber=1">
          here
         </a>
         .
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="7" data-id="70" id="where-can-i-try-this-out-do-you-have-a-retail-or-store-location" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Where can I try this out? Do you have a retail or store location?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Right now, we're all online with a small showroom in our office in Phoenix, Arizona. This is another big reason why our 100 night trial is so awesome. You can try the mattress for 100 nights, and if you don't like it for any reason, return it for a full refund.
        </p>
        <p>
         If you're in the Phoenix area and you'd like to see our showroom, send us an email at support@tuftandneedle.com so we can set you up with an appointment.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="8" data-id="71" id="does-the-tuft-needle-mattress-work-on-an-adjustable-bed-frame" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Does the Tuft &amp; Needle mattress work on an adjustable bed frame?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         We've heard great feedback regarding adjustable bed frames with our mattress. They should work pretty well. If you decide to use our mattress with one, we'd love to hear what you think!
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="8" data-id="72" id="can-i-use-the-tuft-needle-mattress-with-a-heating-pad" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can I use the Tuft &amp; Needle mattress with a heating pad?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Yes, you can use our Tuft &amp; Needle mattress with a heating pad and it will not damage the foam. If you use a specific heating pad that works great, drop us a line and let us know.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="3" data-id="73" id="what-do-i-do-with-my-old-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What do I do with my old mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         As soon as your Tuft &amp; Needle mattress arrives, we suggest our customers schedule a
         <a href="http://www.satruck.org/">
          Salvation Army
         </a>
         pickup or work with your local Saint Vincent de Paul Society. Local churches and homeless shelters are also good options.
        </p>
        <p>
         Keep in mind that in order to donate used mattresses, they need to be rip, tear, and stain free. Usually, there are recycling services in your area which you can schedule to remove your old mattress for a small fee if a charity won't accept the donation.
        </p>
        <p>
         Call or email us if you need some donation or recycling location suggestions and we'd be happy to help find some options in your area.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="6" data-id="74" id="can-the-tuft-needle-mattresses-be-stacked" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can the Tuft &amp; Needle mattresses be stacked?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         We don't recommend stacking the mattresses. When on top of one another, the mattress can become incredibly soft with little to no support. It's also wobbly and can be unsafe. It's best to use the mattress with a firm foundation to get the proper support and comfort.
        </p>
        <p>
         We have iterated on a universal comfort with the parameters of a firm foundation such as a floor, slatted frame, or boxspring. Anything different would change the comfort to be something that we don't understand and haven't tested. Not only that, but it's not great for the health of the mattress over time.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="5" data-id="75" id="can-you-make-custom-sizes" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can you make custom sizes?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         We're currently unable to offer any custom sizes because we're still a small company trying to meet the demands at our current capacity.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="7" data-id="76" id="is-the-tuft-needle-mattress-safe" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Is the Tuft &amp; Needle mattress safe?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         Our mattress is tested by CertiPur, a 3rd party foam certifier, to be free from known harmful chemicals and gasses. More specifically, our mattress is tested to be free from ozone depleters, PBDE flame retardants, heavy metals, formaldehyde, phthalates, and low VOC (Volatile Organic Compound) emissions for indoor air quality (less than 0.5 parts per million).
        </p>
        <p>
         For more information, check out
         <a href="http://certipur.us/for-consumers/">
          CertiPur's website here
         </a>
         .
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="77" id="can-you-expedite-shipping-do-you-have-expedited-shipping-options" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can you expedite shipping? Do you have expedited shipping options?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         We ship our Tuft &amp; Needle mattress via FedEx Ground so we're unable to expedite the shipping or offer expedited shipping options. You can check out estimate transit times to your location after your mattress ships
         <a href="https://www.tuftandneedle.com/support#what-is-the-transit-time-to-my-location">
          here
         </a>
         .
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="2" data-id="78" id="can-i-pickup-my-mattress" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        Can I pickup my mattress?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         If you live in the Phoenix, Arizona area, you can pick up your order in our showroom!
        </p>
        <p>
         Either order online and select "I want to pick up" from your receipt, or just come on in. Not all sizes are available for pickup so call ahead to see what is in inventory. You can reach us at 1-877-842-2586.
        </p>
        <p>
         Read more about our showroom here:
         <a href="https://www.tuftandneedle.com/showroom/phoenix">
          https://www.tuftandneedle.com/showroom/phoenix
         </a>
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
      <section data-faq-category-id="10" data-id="79" id="what-s-the-difference-between-amazon-and-tuft-needle" rel="faq-item">
       <h2 rel="faq-question">
        What's the difference between Amazon and Tuft &amp; Needle?
       </h2>
       <div class="answer">
        <p>
         The biggest differences between our two websites are the Sleep Trial and returns.
        </p>
        <p>
         Orders purchased through Tuft &amp; Needle's website automatically come with a 100 Night Sleep Trial. Alternatively, orders purchased through Amazon come with a 30 Night Sleep Trial per their traditional 30-day return policy.
        </p>
        <p>
         With returns, orders placed through the Tuft &amp; Needle website or "Sold by Tuft &amp; Needle" on Amazon will go through Tuft &amp; Needle for assistance. We'll work with you to donate your mattress to a local charity, and then we'll provide a full refund.
        </p>
        <p>
         Orders purchased on Amazon that are "Sold by Amazon" will go through Amazon's Customer Support for returns. They'll arrange a pickup of the mattress or help with return shipping. Returns for these orders will not go through Tuft &amp; Needle.
        </p>
        <p>
         For both vendors, you should not expect any cost to complete your return and obtain a refund.
        </p>
       </div>
      </section>
     </article>

    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="minicart" id="minicart">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="cart-close" id="cart-close">
      <svg class="icon-x" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">
       <use xlink:href="#icon-x" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
       </use>
      </svg>
     </div>
     <div class="items" ng-show="itemsAny()">
      <table>
       <thead>
        <tr>
         <th class="name">
          Item
         </th>
         <th class="price">
          Price
         </th>
         <th class="quantity">
          Qty
         </th>
         <th class="total">
          Total
         </th>
         <th class="remove">
         </th>
        </tr>
       </thead>
       <tbody>
        <tr ng-repeat="item in items">
         <td class="name">
          {{item.name}}
         </td>
         <td class="price">
          ${{item.cost/100}}
         </td>
         <td class="quantity">
          <span class="decrement" ng-click="decrementItemQuantity(item)">
           <svg class="icon-button-minus" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">
            <use xlink:href="#icon-button-minus" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
            </use>
           </svg>
          </span>
          <span class="quantity">
           {{item.quantity}}
          </span>
          <span class="increment" ng-click="incrementItemQuantity(item)">
           <svg class="icon-button-plus" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">
            <use xlink:href="#icon-button-plus" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
            </use>
           </svg>
          </span>
         </td>
         <td class="total">
          ${{itemTotal(item) /100}}
         </td>
         <td class="remove">
          <span ng-click="removeItem(item)">
           <svg class="icon-button-delete" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMin meet">
            <use xlink:href="#icon-button-delete" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
            </use>
           </svg>
          </span>
         </td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
       <tfoot>
        <tr>
         <td colspan="4">
          Shipping*
         </td>
         <td class="amount">
          {{shippingCostText()}}
         </td>
        </tr>
        <tr class="tax-test-b">
         <td>
          Tax
         </td>
         <td class="amount" colspan="4">
          $0
         </td>
        </tr>
        <tr ng-if="promotionDiscountTotal() &gt; 0">
         <td colspan="4">
          Discount ({{promotion.name}})
         </td>
         <td class="amount">
          - ${{ promotionDiscountTotal() / 100 }}
         </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
         <td colspan="4">
          Total
         </td>
         <td class="amount">
          ${{total() / 100}}
         </td>
        </tr>
       </tfoot>
      </table>

       Secure Checkout
